article.title: TorrentFreak
article.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2019}} {{italic title}} {{short description|Blog on file sharing, copyright infringement, and digital rights}} __NOTOC__ {{Infobox website | name = TorrentFreak | logo = TorrentFreak logo.svg | logo_size = 80px | screenshot = TorrentFreak home page screenshot.png | url = {{URL|https://torrentfreak.com/}} | type = [[Blog]] | language = [[English language|English]] | owner = Lennart Renkema PhD{{cite web |url=http://www.nrc.nl/opinie/article2215167.ece/Piraten_zijn_digitale_pioniers |last1=Pouwelse |first1=Johan |last2=Renkema |first2=Lennart |date=17 April 2009 |title=Piraten zijn digitale pioniers |language=Dutch |trans-title=Pirates are digital pioneers |publisher=[[NRC Handelsblad]] |accessdate=14 June 2010}} | author = Ernesto Van Der Sar
Andy Maxwell
[[Rickard Falkvinge]]
Ben Jones (modified [[WordPress]]) | editor = "Ernesto Van Der Sar" | revenue = Advertisements | license = CC BY-NC 3.0 (text only){{cite web |title=Copyright |url=https://torrentfreak.com/copyright/ |website=TorrentFreak |accessdate=27 October 2018}} | alexa = {{Increase}} 2,395 ({{as of|2019|03|19}}){{cite web|url= https://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/torrentfreak.com | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |title=Torrentfreak.com Traffic, Demographics and Competitors - Alexa |accessdate= 19 March 2019 }} | launch date = {{start date and age|df=yes|2005|11|12}} }} '''TorrentFreak''' (abbreviated '''TF''') is a [[blog]] dedicated to reporting the latest news and trends on the [[BitTorrent]] protocol and [[file sharing]], as well as on [[copyright infringement]] and [[digital rights]]. The website was started in November 2005 by a [[Dutch people|Dutch]]man using the pseudonym "Ernesto Van Der Sar". {{cite web|url=http://uscpwned.blogspot.com/2007/05/final-project-interview-2-ernesto-of.html|title=Pwned: Final Project Interview #2: Ernesto of TorrentFreak.com|date=14 May 2007|last=Injijian|first=Allen|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070630095336/http://uscpwned.blogspot.com/2007/05/final-project-interview-2-ernesto-of.html |archivedate=30 June 2007 |accessdate=7 October 2012}}{{cite journal|journal=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |last=Smith|first=Ethan |last2=McBride|first2=Sarah |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB121781125541508813|title=Web Piracy: The Enemy Within?|date=4 August 2008|accessdate=14 June 2010}} He was joined by Andy "Enigmax" Maxwell and Ben Jones in 2007.{{cite web|url=https://torrentfreak.com/about/|title=About TorrentFreak|accessdate=14 June 2010}} Regular contributors include [[Rickard Falkvinge]], founder of the [[Pirate Party]].Profile. [https://torrentfreak.com/author/rick-falkvinge/ Rick Falkvinge], torrentfreak.com. The online publication eCommerceTimes, in 2009, described "Ernesto" as the pseudonym of Lennart Renkema, owner of TorrentFreak.{{cite web|url=http://www.ecommercetimes.com/story/67472.html |accessdate=7 October 2012 |title=Pirate Bay Decides to Join the Navy |first=Renay |last=San Miguel |publisher=E-Commerce Times |date=30 June 2009}} TorrentFreak's text is [[free content]] under a [[Creative Commons]] [[Creative Commons license#Non-commercial licenses|Attribution-NonCommercial]] version 3.0 license.[https://torrentfreak.com/ Copyright CC] at bottom of sidebar of all article pages. ''torrentfreak.com''{{cite web |title=Copyright |url=https://torrentfreak.com/copyright/ |website=TorrentFreak |accessdate=27 October 2018}} Their lead researcher and community manager is the [[Pirate Party]] activist [[Andrew Norton (Pirate Party)|Andrew Norton]]. == Specialist Areas == According to Canadian law scholar [[Michael Geist]], TorrentFreak "is widely used as a source of original reporting on digital issues".{{cite web |url=http://www.michaelgeist.ca/content/view/4971/125/ |title=The 2009 Copyright Consultation: Setting the Record Straight |date=20 April 2010 |accessdate=14 June 2010 |first=Michael |last=Geist}} Examples are ''[[The Guardian]]'',{{cite news |title='BitTorrent: Copyright lawyers' favourite target reaches 200,000 lawsuits |first=Jemima |last=Kiss |url=https://www.theguardian.com/technology/pda/2011/aug/09/bittorrent-piracy |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |date=9 August 2011 }} ''[[CNN]]'',{{cite news |title='50,000 BitTorrent users sued for alleged illegal downloads |first=Julianne |last=Pepitone |url=http://money.cnn.com/2011/06/10/technology/bittorrent_lawsuits/index.htm |newspaper=[[CNN]] |date=10 June 2011 }} ''[[The Wall Street Journal]]'',{{cite news |title='Web Piracy: The Enemy Within? |first=Sarah |last=McBride |url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB121781125541508813 |newspaper=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |date=4 August 2008 }} and the [[Flemish]] newspaper ''[[De Standaard]]''.{{cite journal |last=Van Cayseele |first=Patrick J. G. |last2=Vanormelingen |first2=Stijn |date=26 February 2009 |title=Prices and Network Effects in Two-Sided Markets: The Belgian Newspaper Industry |ssrn=1404392}}{{cite news |title='Lost' en het mysterie van de illegale downloads |first=Kristof |last=Hoefkens |url=http://www.standaard.be/artikel/detail.aspx?artikelid=0H2QP9IS |newspaper=[[De Standaard]] |date=28 May 2010 |page=36 |language=Dutch |trans-title='Lost' and the mystery of illegal downloads}}{{cite news |title=Prince versus the internet |first=Kristof |last=Hoefkens |url=http://www.standaard.be/artikel/detail.aspx?artikelid=NH2SJP84 |newspaper=[[De Standaard]] |date=8 July 2010 |page=34 |language=Dutch |trans-title=Prince versus the internet}} Frequent areas of reporting include: * The [[City of London]]'s [[Police Intellectual Property Crime Unit]]{{cite web|title=File-sharing site back up after copyright suspension|url=http://www.trademarksandbrandsonline.com/news/file-sharing-site-back-up-after-copyright-suspension-3943|accessdate=23 December 2014}}{{cite news|last1=Lee|first1=Dave|title=Police placing anti-piracy warning ads on illegal sites|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/technology-28523738|accessdate=23 December 2014|date=29 July 2014}} * [[United States Trade Representative]] and [[Notorious Markets]] reports{{cite news|last1=Johnson|first1=Ted|title=U.S. Trade Representative Defends Pending Trade Pact After WikiLeaks Disclosure|url=https://variety.com/2013/biz/news/u-s-trade-representative-says-pending-pact-has-zero-to-do-with-sopa-1200838860/|accessdate=2 January 2015|date=15 November 2013}} * Anti-piracy [[Block (Internet)|Web Blocking]]{{cite news|last1=Cooke|first1=Chris|title=MPAA research bigs up UK web-blocking|url=http://www.completemusicupdate.com/article/mpaa-research-bigs-up-uk-web-blocking/|accessdate=23 December 2014|date=1 September 2014}} * [[Torrent tracker]] news{{cite news|last1=Knowles|first1=Jamillah|title=UK Pirate Party sees more than 1.8m visits in 24 hours after ISPs block The Pirate Bay website|url=https://thenextweb.com/uk/2012/05/18/uk-pirate-party-sees-more-than-1-8m-visits-in-24-hours-after-isps-block-the-pirate-bay-website/|accessdate=2 January 2015|date=18 May 2012}} * [[VPN]] Review{{cite news|last1=Henry|first1=Alan|title=Five Best VPN Service Providers|url=http://lifehacker.com/5935863/five-best-vpn-service-providers|accessdate=2 January 2015|date=23 March 2014}} * [[File sharing]] website news * [[Copyright]] law news And other news affecting 'copyright, privacy and everything related to file sharing'{{cite web|title=About|url=http://torrentfreak.com/about/|accessdate=2 January 2015}} == Notable History == On 17 August 2007, TorrentFreak reported that [[Comcast]] had begun [[Bandwidth throttling|throttling]] its upload bandwidth, specifically against BitTorrent users. This made [[Glossary of BitTorrent terms#Seed|seeding]], which is an essential part of the BitTorrent protocol, effectively impossible.{{cite web |url=http://www.lightreading.com/document.asp?doc_id=132115 |title=Comcast Takes on TorrentFreak |first=Ryan |last=Lawler |date=21 August 2007 |accessdate=14 June 2010 |publisher=Light Reading}} It was later determined that Comcast was using [[Sandvine]] products, which implement network traffic shaping and policing, and include support for both blocking new and forcefully terminating established network connections. [[Comcast]] has denied these claims whenever they have been asked to comment. A guide, for customer service representatives when asked about Comcast's BitTorrent throttling, was leaked to [[The Consumerist]] on 26 October 2007.{{cite web |url=http://consumerist.com/consumer/leaks/comcasts-we-dont-throttle-bittorrent-internal-talking-points-memo-315791.php |title=Comcast's "We Don't Throttle BitTorrent" Internal Talking Points Memo |publisher=[[The Consumerist]] |date=26 October 2007 |accessdate=14 June 2010 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071027093002/http://consumerist.com/consumer/leaks/comcasts-we-dont-throttle-bittorrent-internal-talking-points-memo-315791.php |archivedate=27 October 2007}} In October 2008 through to March 2011 TorrentFreak ran short lived video news service titled 'torrentfreak.tv directed by [[Andrej Preston]], founder of torrent site [[Suprnova]] made available for streaming and download on [[Mininova]].{{cite news|last1=Ernesto|title=TorrentFreak TV Is Back!|url=http://torrentfreak.com/torrentfreak-tv-is-back/|accessdate=2 January 2015|date=20 March 2011}}{{cite news|last1=Roettgers|first1=Janko|title=Suprnova.org: Former Pirate King Embraces Web Video|url=https://gigaom.com/2011/05/14/suprnova-torrent-site-web-video/|accessdate=2 January 2015|date=14 May 2011}} On 21 August 2013, Comcast threatened TorrentFreak for writing about publicly available court documents.{{cite news|last1=Franceschi-Bicchierai|first1=Lorenzo|title=Comcast Threatens to Sue TorrentFreak for Copyright Infringement|url=http://mashable.com/2013/08/21/comcast-torrentfreak-copyright-infringement/|accessdate=2 January 2015|date=21 August 2013}}{{cite web|title=Comcast Threatens to Sue TorrentFreak for Copyright Infringement (updated)|url=https://torrentfreak.com/comcast-threatens-to-sue-torrentfreak-for-copyright-infringement-130821/ |publisher=TorrentFreak |date=21 August 2013 |accessdate=21 August 2013}} The underlying document links a Comcast subscriber with the [[Prenda Law]] firm.{{cite web|title=Comcast Business Record Affidavit|url=https://www.docketalarm.com/cases/Georgia_Northern_District_Court/2--12-cv-00262/AF_Holdings_LLC_v._Patel/61/15/|publisher=Docket Alarm, Inc.|accessdate=21 August 2013}} The court case where the document was filed was a copyright infringement lawsuit brought by AF Holdings for alleged infringement of an adult movie.{{cite web|title=Docket for AF Holdings, LLC v. Patel, 2:12-cv-00262, No. 1 (N.D.Ga.)|url=https://www.docketalarm.com/cases/Georgia_Northern_District_Court/2--12-cv-00262/AF_Holdings_LLC_v._Patel/|publisher=Docket Alarm, Inc.}}{{cite web|title=Complaint, AF Holdings, LLC v. Patel, 2:12-cv-00262, No. 1 (N.D.Ga. Nov. 2, 2012)|url=https://www.docketalarm.com/cases/Georgia_Northern_District_Court/2--12-cv-00262/AF_Holdings_LLC_v._Patel/1/|publisher=Docket Alarm, Inc.|accessdate=21 August 2013}} In August 2013 [[Web blocking in the United Kingdom|web blocking technology]] implementation by [[Sky Broadband]] blocked the site for UK customers after [[EZTV]] manipulated its [[DNS]] servers{{cite news|last1=Shubber|first1=Kadhim|title=News site TorrentFreak 'blocked' by Sky's piracy filter|url=https://www.wired.co.uk/news/archive/2013-08/09/torrentfreak-blocked|accessdate=23 December 2014|date=9 August 2013}} and was blocked once again by the controversial Sky Broadband Shield parental filter system in January 2014.{{cite news|last1=Brewster|first1=Thomas|title=TorrentFreak News Site Blocked By Sky Porn Filter|url=http://www.techweekeurope.co.uk/workspace/torrentfreak-blocked-by-sky-filter-135024#IBofIe5AmFVSk7bp.99|accessdate=23 December 2014|date=6 January 2014}} == References == {{reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{Official website|https://torrentfreak.com/}} {{BitTorrent|state=collapsed}} [[Category:News websites]] [[Category:File sharing communities]] [[Category:Blogs]] [[Category:BitTorrent]] [[Category:Publications established in 2005]] [[Category:Free-content websites]] [[Category:Copyright infringement]] [[Category:File sharing news sites]]
